unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Sharpening Focus on Quality Control**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Sharpening Focus on Quality Control

unnormalised: Manufacturers across India are increasingly prioritizing robust quality control measures to enhance competitiveness and minimize costly recalls. This shift comes amidst growing consumer awareness and stricter regulatory standards.
normalised: Manufacturers across India are increasingly prioritizing robust quality control measures to enhance competitiveness and minimize costly recalls. This shift comes amidst growing consumer awareness and stricter regulatory standards.

unnormalised: Experts at IIT Delhi highlighted on 25/10/2024 the importance of statistical process control (SPC) techniques in minimizing defects and ensuring consistent product quality. They cited examples of successful implementation in the automotive component industry in Chennai.

unnormalised: "Investing in quality from the raw material stage right through to the packaging and dispatch is crucial," says Ms. Priya Sharma, a quality control manager at a textile mill in Surat. She emphasizes that diligent monitoring at 14:00 hrs daily prevents issues down the line.
normalised: "Investing in quality from the raw material stage right through to the packaging and dispatch is crucial," says Ms. Priya Sharma, a quality control manager at a textile mill in Surat. She emphasizes that diligent monitoring at two P M daily prevents issues down the line.

unnormalised: A recent survey conducted on 01/01/2024 revealed that companies implementing ISO 9001 standards experience a 15% reduction in product defects. This underscores the value of standardized processes and rigorous audits. Proper quality control not only benefits consumers but also strengthens the "Make in India" initiative, enhancing brand reputation and fostering trust.
